block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Music
APPEL FARM ARTS AND MUSIC CENTER Safire, the Uppity Blues Women. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22. 457 Shirley Road, Elmer. (800)394-1211.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Music
APPEL FARM ARTS AND MUSIC CENTER Safire, the Uppity Blues Women. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22. 457 Shirley Road, Elmer. (800)394-1211.

BENJAMIN FRANKLIN MIDDLE SCHOOL Ridgewood Concert Band, featuring Scott Brubaker, horn player. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for those 62-plus and students; $6 for students. Corner of Glen and Van Dien Avenues, Ridgewood. (201)493-1111.
BICKFORD THEATER Wyeth Jazz Showcase: Marty Grosz's Incandescent Four. Monday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $13; $12 for members. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973)971-3706.

COMMUNITY THEATER Chorovaya Akademia, 16-voice men's a cappella choir. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $30. Vladimir Feltsman, pianist. Saturday at 8:30; lecture at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $16 to $38. 100 South Street, Morristown. (973)539-8008.

CONGREGATION SHOMREI EMUNAH Montclair Chamber Ensemble; Oscar Ravina, conductor; Robert Miller, pianist. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 in advance; $10 for students. 67 Park Street, Montclair. (973)429-2762..

J.C.C. METROWEST Kenny Barron, Renee Rosnes and Shai Bachar. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30; $25 for members, students and those 62-plus. Part of a Chamber Music Series, the Trio Solisti will perform. Next Sunday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $30; $26 for members, students and those 62-plus. Maurice Levin Theater, 760 Northfield Avenue, West Orange. (973)736-3200, extension 253.

JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS Bluegrass program, with Sam Bush, mandolin player, and Alison Brown, banjoist. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $30. ''Live Sax Acts,'' with David Dorfman and Dan Froot. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201)567-3600.

MAXWELL'S Buck 65; Dalek; Oddateee. Today at 9 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 in advance. Merciana; Loudermilk; All Systems Go. Wednesday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $7. Slobberbone. Thursday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $8. John Wesley Harding; Mary Timony. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $10; Charlie Hunter, at 10:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. 1039 Washington Street, Hoboken. (201)653-1703.
MINSTREL COFFEEHOUSE David Masengill and Carla Ulbrich. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $6. Morris County Park Commission Cultural Center, 300 Mendham Road, Morristown. (973)335-9489.
MONMOUTH COUNTY LIBRARY Oscar Petty, oboist. Today at 2 p.m. Free. 125 Symmes Drive, Manalapan. (732)431-7242.
MT. HEBRON SCHOOL AUDITORIUM Manuel Barrueco, guitarist. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $30. 173 Bellevue Avenue. (973)655-4086.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Barbara Cook in ''Mostly Sondheim,'' with Wally Harper, musical director. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $13 to $47. Prudential Hall. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra, featuring Daniel Rodriguez, the New York City singing policeman, and Kristin Chenoweth, Broadway vocalist. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $19 to $72. Prudential Hall. Dee Dee Bridgewater. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $35. Prudential Hall. Bela Fleck and the Flecktones. Next Sunday at 3 p. Tickets: $13 to $49. Prudential Hall. One Center Street, Newark. (908)255-3476.
OUTPOST IN THE BURBS Steve Forbert. Friday at 8:30; doors open at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 in advance. First Congregational Church, 40 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair. (973)744-6560.

WILLIAM PATERSON UNIVERSITY ''Three Folk Divas'': Lucy Kaplansky, Patty Larkin and Susan Werner. Saturday at 8 p.m Tickets: $24; $22 for those 65-plus. Shea Center for Performing Arts, 300 Pompton Road, Wayne. (973)720-2371.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Seth Himmelhoch, classical guitarist, and Ripe, a seven-member pop-rock band, will perform classical guitar works. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $10. Sharp Theater, Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201)684-7844.

RIDER UNIVERSITY Westminster Schola Cantorum. Saturday at 8 p.m. Westminster Jubilee Singers. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 for students and those 62-plus. Bristol Chapel, Westminster Choir College, Princeton. (609)921-2663.
SCOTTISH RITE AUDITORIUM Joan Baez. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $29 and $34. Dee Dee Bridgewater. Next Sunday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $28. White Horse Pike, Collingswood. (856)338-9000.
SETON HALL UNIVERSITY Orpheus Chamber Orchestra. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $8 for those 62-plus; free for students. Kozlowski Hall, South Orange. (973)761-9098.

STATE THEATER James Galway, flutist, and Phillip Moll, pianist. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $50. Neil Sedaka. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $50. Boris Godunov by Teatro Lirico D'Europa. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $45. Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732)246-7469.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER John Hammond. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. 18 Stirling Road, Watchung (a mile from either Route 22 or Interstate 78). (908)753-0190.
Museums and Galleries

AMERICAN LABOR MUSEUM ''Union Square: America's Soapbox,'' photographs taken at political demonstrations. Through April 27. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m., or by appointment. Botto House National Landmark, 83 Norwood Street, Haledon. (973)595-7953.
ARIELLE'S GALLERY Paintings by Dennis Sirrine. Through May 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. 20 North Dean Street, Englewood. (201)894-0405.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART ''Living Landscapes: Urban and Rural Perspectives.'' Through April 7. ''Matt Schwede: Paper Hearts, Organic Tissues.'' Through May 24. ''The Art of Containment.'' Through May 24. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908)735-8415.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM ''Lightbox: Visual AIDS,'' works by more than 200 artists. Through May 27. ''Dahlia Elsayed: Monuments of Her Last Year.'' Through April 27. ''The Challenge of a Growing Nation: Post-Independence, Industrialization and the American Landscape.'' Through Aug. 31. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays noon to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays and Fridays 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Admission: $4; $2 for children over 12, students and those 62-plus; free for children under 12. 350 Montgomery Street, Jersey City. (201)413-0303.
KERYGMA GALLERY Paintings by Gerard Doudera. Opens Tuesday. Through April 19. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 38 Oak Street, Ridgewood. (201)444-5510.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Betty Woodman: Two Bronze Benches and Four Ceramic Pictures of Korean Paintings.'' Through April 13. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $8; $6 for those 62-plus and students; free for members and children under 12; free on Fridays, 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973)746-5555.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY ''Pleasant Tasting Kim-chi,'' selected works from the faculty of the Art and Design Department of Won Kwang University in South Korea. Through April 5. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Life Hall, next to Memorial Auditorium, Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973)655-5113.

MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAN HUNGARIAN FOUNDATION ''From the Old World to the New World -- Recent Additions to the Museum Collection.'' Through April 20. $5 suggested donation. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 300 Somerset Street between Division and Bethany Streets, New Brunswick. (732)846-5777.

NEW JERSEY CENTER FOR VISUAL ARTS Paintings by Alexandra Isaievych that evoke magical dream-like settings. Through April 17. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays 2 to 4 p.m. Palmer Gallery, 68 Elm Street, Summit. (908)273-9121.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Great Pots: Contemporary Ceramics From Function to Fantasy.'' Through June 1. ''Armando Rascón: Border Xicanography,'' a multimedia installation that focuses on the border between Mexico and the United States. Through Saturday. ''Dynamic Earth: Revealing Nature's Secrets.'' Long running. ''Courtly Arts of the Indian Subcontinent.'' Through June. ''The Ancient Buddhist Kingdoms of South Asia.'' Through June. ''Southeast Asian Images in Stone and Terra Cotta.'' Through June. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973)596-6550.

WALKER-KORNBLUTH GALLERY Pastels of garden and floral scenes by Christine Debrosky, and New Jersey neighborhood locales and interiors by Daniel Finaldi. Opens today. Through April 20. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. 7-21 Fair Lawn Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201)791-3374.

ZIMMERLI ART MUSEUM ''Oh, Those Mice! Children's Book Illustrations From the Rutgers Collection.'' Through April 20. ''George Segal: Sculpture, Paintings and Drawings From the Artist's Studio.'' ''The Graphic Face of the Post-Revolutionary and Stalinist Periods: Russian Cover Design, 1920's-30's.'' Through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Rutgers University, George and Hamilton Streets, New Brunswick. (732)932-7237, extension 610.
Theater
ALLEGRO PRODUCTIONS ''The Odd Couple.'' Sundays at 2 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $15 for those 65-plus. 1130 Knoll Road, Lake Hiawatha. (973)263-7020.

BERGEN COUNTY PLAYERS ''The Gingerbread Lady.'' Sundays at 2 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for matinees. Through April 12. Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road, Oradell. (201)261-4200.

CHESTER THEATER ''Time Flies,'' comedies by David Ives. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; also next Sunday at 2 p.m. Through April 5. Tickets: $15; $12 for those 62-plus and students except Saturday evening. Black River Playhouse, Grove Street, Chester. (908)879-7304.

GEORGE STREET PLAYHOUSE ''The Last Bridge,'' by Wendy Kessleman. Begins Tuesday. Tuesday through Friday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 2 and 8 p.m; next Sunday at 2 and 7 p.m. Through April 20. Call for schedule. Tickets: $22 to $55. 9 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732)246-7717.

KEAN UNIVERSITY Kean Dance Theater. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for those 62-plus, faculty, staff and alumni; $10 for students. Wilkins Theater, 1000 Morris Avenue, Union. (908)737-7469.

McCARTER THEATER ''Fiction,'' by Steven Dietz. Begins Tuesday. Tuesday through Friday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 4 and 8:30 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Through April 13. Tickets: $31 to $47. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. For show times: (609)258-2787.
NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Hubbard Street Dance Chicago. Today at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $39 and $46. Victoria Hall, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888)466-5722.
PEDDIE SCHOOL American Repertory Ballet will celebrate the works of women choreographers. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. William Mount-Burke Theater, South Main Street, Hightstown. (609)490-7550.
PLAYWRIGHTS THEATER OF NEW JERSEY ''Six Short Comedies,'' presented by the Teachers Theater of New Jersey. Saturday at 8 p.m. $5 suggested donation. 33 Green Village Road, Madison. (732)572-7340.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY-CAMDEN ''The World Goes Around.'' Wednesday at 4:45 p.m.; Thursday and Friday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 2:30 and 8 p.m. Tickets: $8; $5 for those 62-plus and students. Gordon Theater Fine Arts Building, Third and Pearl Streets, Camden. (856)225-6211.

TWELVE MILES WEST THEATER COMPANY ''Bright Ideas.'' Sundays at 3 p.m.; Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m. Through April 12. Tickets: $20; $17 for those 62-plus and students. 488 Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair. (973)746-7181.
TWO RIVER THEATER COMPANY ''Salome'' and ''A Florentine Tragedy.'' Through next Sunday. Call for schedule. Tickets: $19 to $35. Algonquin Arts Theater, 171 Main Street, Manasquan. (732)345-1400.
UNION COUNTY ARTS CENTER ''On Golden Pond,'' starring Jack Klugman. Next Sunday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $32. Tickets: $15 to $25. 1601 Irving Street, Rahway. (732)499-8226.
Etc.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Sports Films: Blue Chips,'' with a short commentary about the film before the screening. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Seating is limited. Mackay Room, 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201)568-2215, extension 244.
MAURICE M. PINE PUBLIC LIBRARY A screening of ''La Strada'' (1954). Monday at 10:30 a.m. Free. 10-01 Fair Lawn Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201)796-3400.
MONMOUTH COUNTY LIBRARY ''Boy Meets Girl,'' starring James Cagney. Thursday at 7 p.m. 1001 Route 35. (732)842-5995.
MONMOUTH COUNTY LIBRARY Screening of ''All Through the Night,'' starring Humphrey Bogart. Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. 125 Symmes Drive, Manalapan. (732)431-7242.
NATIONAL GUARD ARMORY ''Spring Crafts at Morristown.'' Today, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $6. Western Avenue, Morristown. (973)455-0338.
RIDGEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Angela's Ashes.'' Tuesday at 10 a.m. Free. 125 North Maple Avenue, Ridgewood. (201)670-5600.
Spoken Word

BURLINGTON COUNTY COLLEGE Lalita Tademy, author of ''Cane River, will be the featured speaker. Wednesday from 1:30 to 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Pemberton Campus Theater, Pemberton. (609)894-9311, extension 7498.

FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON UNIVERSITY ''Germany and the European Expansion,'' with Gunter Pleuger, Permanent Representative of Germany to the United Nations. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Muscarelle Center, Room 105, Metropolitan Campus, River Road, Teaneck. (201)692-7028.

HOBOKEN HISTORICAL MUSEUM ''Poetry Series,'' featuring readings by Ed Smith, Adeena Karasick and Joe Weil. $5 for non-members; members free. Friday at 7 p.m. 1301 Hudson Street, Hoboken. (201)656-2240, extension 2.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY ''Saint Mary's Church and the Anti-Catholic Know-Nothingism Attacks of 1854,'' with Augustine Curley. Tuesday at 5:30 p.m. Free. (973)275-2378. ''Poetry in the Round,'' presents Desmond Egan. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. Walsh Library, Seton Hall University, 400 South Orange Avenue, South Orange. (973)761-9388.
For Children
COUNT BASIE THEATER ''Cinderella.'' Today at 1 p.m. Tickets: $12. 99 Monmouth Street, Red Bank. (732)842-9000.

EDGEWATER PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Jig, Fig and Mrs. Pig,'' story time with Peter Hansard. Monday at 4 p.m. ''Among the Hidden,'' by Margaret Petersen Haddix will be the subject of a book discussion for grades 5 and older. Tuesday at 4 p.m. Pre-registration required. Free. 49 Hudson Avenue, Edgewater. (201)224-6144.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''James and the Giant Peach.'' Friday at 10 a.m.; Saturday at 11 a.m.; next Sunday at 1 p.m. Tickets: $12. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732)548-0582.

GROWING STAGE ''Peter Pan.'' Friday at 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays at 4 p.m. Through next Sunday. Tickets: $12; $8 for children and those 62-plus. The Historic Palace Theater, Route 183, 7 Ledgewood Avenue, Netcong. (973)347-4946. NEW JERSEY STATE AQUARIUM ''Caribbean Adventure,'' with sounds and flavors of the Caribbean islands, including a pirate-themed dive show in the Open Ocean Tank (12:45 and 2:15 p.m.), games, music and dance. Saturday from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Permanent exhibitions include the Deep Atlantic Open Ocean Tank, Seal Shores exhibition and the Conservation Outreach and Observation Lab. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 am. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and a.m. to 5 p.. Tickets: $13.95; $10.95 for children; students and those 62-plus, $11.95; children under 2 free. 1 Riverside Drive, Camden. (800)616-5297.

RAMAPO COLLEGE The Red Balloon: Visible Fictions Theater Company. Today at 1 and 4 p.m. Tickets: $12; $10 for those 62-plus; $7 for students. Sharp Theater, Russ Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201)684-7888.
ON THE TOWNS
